5.eng:
Illustrations:  Ari and Elaine Vitikainen 

Information was taken from WHO websites such as https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public

Version 6.4.2020

10.eng: Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or clean them with an alcohol-based hand rub.

11.eng: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.

12.eng: Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Dispose of the used tissue immediately.

13.eng:
Maintain a distance of 2 meters between yourself and others. 
Avoid unnecessary travel and stay away from large groups of people.

14.eng:
Stay at home if you feel unwell.
If you have a fever, cough or difficulty breathing, seek medical attention early.

15.eng:
Stay informed about the latest developments on COVID-19. 
Find information from reliable
sources and  follow the advice given by your healthcare provider.

bookText.eng:
Avoid Covid-19 (Africa)



Avoid Covid-19 (Africa)
Illustrations:  Ari and Elaine Vitikainen 

Information was taken from WHO websites such as https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public

Version 6.4.2020
Literacy for Women in Africa



Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or clean them with an alcohol-based hand rub.


Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.

Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Dispose of the used tissue immediately.



Maintain a distance of 2 meters between yourself and others. 
Avoid unnecessary travel and stay away from large groups of people. 



Stay at home if you feel unwell.
If you have a fever, cough or difficulty breathing, seek medical attention early.


Stay informed about the latest developments on COVID-19. 
Find information from reliable
sources and  follow the advice given by your healthcare provider.

summary: Basic information on how to avoid Coronavirus (Covid-19)
title: Avoid Covid-19 (Africa)
